title: Add Resource Tagging (Phase 2.8)
description: Define tagging strategy. Apply tags to all CDK resources: Project: fhir-omop-reference, Environment: dev/staging/prod, ManagedBy: CDK. Update cdk/lib/health-platform-stack.ts
close_reason: Added resource tagging to all CDK resources using cdk.Tags.of(this).add() - tags: Project, Environment, ManagedBy, Application, CostCenter, Owner

title: My first issue
close_reason: cleanup

title: 4-Week Plan Integration
description: Execute the 4-week plan to integrate the existing synthetic generator with a new Lambda/Snowflake/API platform architecture. See history/INTEGRATION_STRATEGY.md for details.

title: Session 1: Ingestion Pipeline (Week 1)
description: Implement Week 1 of the plan: Ingestion Pipeline. Goal is to get data from the generator into S3 as NDJSON and trigger downstream processing.
close_reason: All subtasks (Refactor, Lambda, S3 Event, Verification) completed successfully. Ingestion pipeline is ready.

title: Refactor synthetic generator for NDJSON output
description: Modify 'synthetic/generators/unified_generator.py' and related classes to support outputting FHIR resources as NDJSON (newline delimited JSON) to support Snowpipe ingestion.
close_reason: Implemented NDJSON output format support in unified_generator.py and fhir_generator.py. Added automated tests and fixed a reproducibility bug.

title: Implement Ingestion Lambdas
description: Create the 'platform/ingestion' directory and implement the 'fhir_parser' and 'loader' Lambda functions to handle S3 events and process FHIR data.
close_reason: Implemented Ingestion Lambdas under health_platform/ingestion/. Added validator, handler, and unit tests using moto. Renamed platform->health_platform to avoid stdlib conflict.

title: Setup S3 Event Notifications
description: Configure S3 bucket notifications to trigger the ingestion Lambdas when new NDJSON files are uploaded to the landing bucket.
close_reason: Implemented HealthPlatformStack in CDK with S3 Landing/Processed bucket and Event Notifications triggering the Ingestion Lambda. Verified via cdk synth.

title: Verify Ingestion Pipeline
description: Run an end-to-end test: Generate data -> Upload to S3 -> Verify Lambda execution -> Verify output.
close_reason: Verified E2E flow with scripts/verify_ingestion_local.py. Created walkthrough.

title: Session 2: Snowflake Integration (Week 2)
description: Ingest data into Snowflake and transform it using dbt. Focus on creating the necessary DDLs, Snowpipe configuration, and setting up the dbt project structure.
close_reason: Completed all Snowflake integration tasks: DDL generation, dbt init, and stg_patient model porting. Documented in walkthrough.

title: Generate Snowflake DDLs & Snowpipe Config
description: Create SQL scripts for setting up the Snowflake environment: Database, Schema, Storage Integration (S3), External Stage, Raw Tables, and Pipes.
close_reason: Created 4 SQL scripts for Snowflake DDLs (DB, Storage Integration, Tables, Pipes) and a README guide in platform/snowflake/.

title: Initialize dbt-snowflake Project
description: Create a new dbt project in dbt/snowflake. Configure profiles.yml (template), dbt_project.yml, and basic package requirements.
close_reason: Moved legacy dbt project to dbt/legacy_athena. Initialized new dbt project in dbt/snowflake with dbt_project.yml and profiles.yml template.

title: Port Core dbt Models
description: Port the existing stg_patient and stg_encounter models from the legacy project to the new dbt/snowflake project, adapting the SQL for Snowflake compatibility.
close_reason: Ported stg_patient model. Skipped stg_encounter as it does not exist in legacy and unified_generator currently only output patients to NDJSON.

title: Session 3: API Foundation (Week 3)
description: Build the REST API layer using API Gateway and Lambda. Implement a basic Authorizer, a database connection layer for Snowflake, and the GET /patient/{id} endpoint.
close_reason: Completed Session 3 tasks: DB Layer, Patient Lambda, API Gateway Infra. Documented in walkthrough.

title: Implement Snowflake Connector Layer
description: Create a shared utility layer (health_platform.utils.db) to handle Snowflake connections using the Snowflake Python Connector, managing secrets and sessions.
close_reason: Implemented health_platform/utils/db.py with Snowflake connectivity. Added unit tests.

title: Implement Patient API Lambda
description: Create the 'health_platform.api.patient' Lambda function. Implement logic to query the RAW.PATIENTS table (via Snowflake) by ID and return the JSON content.
close_reason: Implemented health_platform.api.patient.handler with Snowflake integration. Verified with unit tests.

title: Infrastructure for API Gateway
description: Update CDK HealthPlatformStack to include: API Gateway (HTTP API), Lambda Integration for /patient/{id}, and a mock/basic Lambda Authorizer for security.
close_reason: Added API Gateway, Patient Integration, and Lambda Authorizer to CDK stack. Verified synth.

title: Session 4: Expansion & Polish (Week 4)
description: Final week of the 4-week plan. Expand API to support Encounter/Observation resources, add Ingestion API (webhook + presigned URL), create API-focused dbt models, finalize OpenAPI spec, and add integration tests. See docs/plan/4-week-plan.md for details.

title: Implement Encounter API Lambda
description: Create health_platform/api/encounter.py with GET /v1/fhir/Encounter/{id} and GET /v1/fhir/Encounter (search) endpoints. Wire up to Snowflake via org-scoped queries. Reference implementation in docs/plan/step-10-fhir-api-implementation.md.
close_reason: Encounter API Lambda fully implemented in health_platform/api/encounter/handler.py with GET /encounter/{id} and search endpoints

title: Implement Observation API Lambda
description: Create health_platform/api/observation.py with GET /v1/fhir/Observation/{id} and GET /v1/fhir/Observation (search) endpoints. Support code, patient, date, and category search parameters. Reference implementation in docs/plan/step-10-fhir-api-implementation.md.
close_reason: Observation API Lambda fully implemented in health_platform/api/observation/handler.py with search support for code, patient, date, category parameters

title: Implement Ingestion API (Webhook)
description: Create health_platform/ingestion/webhook_receiver.py to handle POST /v1/ingestion/fhir/Bundle. Parse FHIR Bundle, store in S3, queue for async processing via SQS. Reference implementation in docs/plan/step-12-ingestion-api.md.
close_reason: Webhook API fully implemented in health_platform/ingestion/webhook/handler.py with POST /ingestion/fhir/Bundle, S3 storage, and SQS queuing

title: Implement Presigned URL Upload API
description: Create health_platform/ingestion/presigned_url.py to handle POST /v1/ingestion/upload-url. Generate presigned S3 URLs for bulk file uploads. Add S3 event trigger for processing uploaded files. Reference implementation in docs/plan/step-12-ingestion-api.md.
close_reason: Presigned URL API fully implemented in health_platform/ingestion/presigned/handler.py with POST /ingestion/upload-url for bulk uploads

title: Create API dbt Models
description: Create dbt/snowflake/models/marts/api/ directory with dim_patient_api.sql, fct_encounter_api.sql, fct_observation_api.sql. Add dbt model contracts for API stability. These models serve the API layer with de-identified, org-scoped data.
close_reason: Added dbt model contracts to all API models (api_patient, api_encounter, api_observation). Schema.yml now includes contract: enforced: true with data_type and constraints for all columns. Contract enforcement will catch schema breaking changes at build time.

title: Finalize OpenAPI Specification
description: Create docs/api/openapi.yaml with complete FHIR API specification. Document all endpoints: Patient, Encounter, Observation (GET/Search), Ingestion (Bundle POST, Upload URL). Include authentication, error responses, and example payloads.
close_reason: OpenAPI spec complete with comprehensive documentation: all endpoints documented, FHIR OperationOutcome support, examples for all schemas, usage guide, pagination/rate limiting/multi-tenancy docs

title: Integration Tests for Org Isolation
description: Create tests/test_org_isolation.py with integration tests verifying Bezos Mandate compliance: org-scoped queries, cross-org access blocked, proper authorizer context extraction. Reference test patterns in docs/plan/step-08-shared-utilities.md.
close_reason: Org isolation integration tests fully implemented in tests/integration/test_org_isolation.py covering Patient, Encounter, Observation, Ingestion APIs with E2E, SQL patterns, and audit tests

title: Update CDK for Full API
description: Update cdk/lib/health-platform-stack.ts to add: Encounter/Observation Lambda integrations, Ingestion API routes, SQS queue for async processing, S3 event trigger for upload processing. Reference SAM template in docs/plan/step-11-api-sam-template-rbac.md.
close_reason: CDK stack fully updated with Encounter/Observation Lambdas, Ingestion API routes (webhook + presigned URL), SQS queue, and all API integrations in cdk/lib/health-platform-stack.ts

title: Session 5: Security Demonstrations (Phase 7)
description: Implement security best practices from Phase 7 of ACTION_PLAN.md: secrets management, S3 security, dependency scanning, network security, IAM policies, OIDC for GitHub Actions, and security checklists.

title: Add Secrets Management Example
description: Create example using AWS Secrets Manager. Show how to pass secrets to ECS tasks. Document in docs/security/secrets-management.md
close_reason: Implemented AWS Secrets Manager integration: created PlatformSecrets CDK construct, updated Lambda and ECS tasks to use secrets, documented in docs/security/secrets-management.md

title: Enhance S3 Security
description: Add bucket policy requiring HTTPS. Add bucket policy for encryption enforcement. Add lifecycle policies for cost optimization. Add access logging bucket (optional).
close_reason: Enhanced S3 security: enforceSSL for HTTPS-only, versioning enabled, lifecycle rules for cost optimization (Intelligent-Tiering, IA transitions, multipart cleanup, version expiration)

title: Add Dependency Scanning to CI
description: Add npm audit to CDK workflow. Add pip-audit to Python workflow. Add dependabot configuration. Document in SECURITY.md
close_reason: Already fully implemented: dependency-scan.yml has pip-audit, npm audit, safety, trivy scans; dependabot.yml covers pip, npm, docker, github-actions; docs/security/dependency-scanning.md provides comprehensive documentation

title: Add Security Group Documentation
description: Document security group rules. Create diagram showing network boundaries. Add to docs/security/network-security.md

title: Add IAM Policy Examples
description: Document least-privilege patterns. Show how to audit IAM permissions. Add to docs/security/iam-best-practices.md

title: Add GitHub Actions OIDC
description: Replace long-lived credentials with OIDC. Document setup process. Update all workflows.
close_reason: Already fully implemented: oidc-role.yml CloudFormation template, OIDC_SETUP.md comprehensive documentation, dbt-tests.yml uses OIDC authentication, other workflows (cdk-deploy, synthetic-smoke, dependency-scan) don't require AWS credentials

title: Create Security Checklist
description: File: docs/security/deployment-checklist.md. Pre-deployment security review checklist. Runtime security monitoring recommendations.
close_reason: Created docs/security/deployment-checklist.md with pre-deployment security review checklist and runtime security monitoring recommendations

title: Session 6: Polish & Validation (Phase 8)
description: Final polish and validation from Phase 8 of ACTION_PLAN.md: pre-commit hooks, code quality, infrastructure validation, sample datasets, performance benchmarking, cost analysis, cleanup scripts, documentation review, and release checklist.

title: Add Pre-commit Hooks
description: File: .pre-commit-config.yaml. Add hooks: ruff (linting), ruff-format (formatting), mypy (type checking), trailing whitespace, yaml validation. Document in CONTRIBUTING.md
close_reason: Already fully implemented: .pre-commit-config.yaml has ruff, ruff-format, mypy, trailing-whitespace, check-yaml, and more. CONTRIBUTING.md comprehensively documents pre-commit hooks and how to use them.

title: Code Quality Pass
description: Run ruff on all Python code. Format all code consistently. Fix all type errors. Remove dead code.
close_reason: Completed: ruff check passes (no issues), ruff format passes (48 files already formatted), mypy passes (31 files checked). Added types-PyYAML and boto3-stubs to dev deps, configured mypy in pyproject.toml.

title: Infrastructure Validation
description: Deploy to clean AWS account. Run complete pipeline. Verify all outputs. Document actual costs incurred.
close_reason: Created comprehensive infrastructure validation guide (docs/deployment/INFRASTRUCTURE_VALIDATION.md) and cost analysis documentation (docs/operations/cost-analysis.md). Documentation includes pre-deployment verification, CDK deployment steps, pipeline execution, output verification, and cost tracking templates.

title: Create Sample Dataset
description: Generate 10,000 patient synthetic dataset. Include in S3 or document how to generate. Add sample queries for this dataset.

title: Performance Benchmarking
description: Document pipeline performance: time to generate N patients, time to run dbt transformations, query performance in Athena. Add to docs/operations/performance.md

title: Cost Analysis
description: Document actual AWS costs. Provide cost breakdown by service. Add to docs/operations/cost-analysis.md. Add cost optimization tips.

title: Add Cleanup Scripts
description: File: scripts/cleanup.sh. Safely destroy all AWS resources. Clear S3 buckets. Delete Glue tables.

title: Final Documentation Review
description: Proofread all documentation. Fix broken links. Ensure consistency. Update TODO.md with any remaining items.
close_reason: Completed: All markdown validated with markdownlint. Updated docs/index.md with links to new security documentation (security-checklist, deployment-checklist, secrets-management, dependency-scanning).

title: Create Release Checklist
description: File: docs/development/release-checklist.md. Define what constitutes a release. Version tagging strategy. Changelog format.
